private_information: You are allowed to move disks A B C D E only
You can place your disk only on top of a larger disk or an empty peg
agent_1.goal: Contribute to achieving the final configuration by moving allowed disks according to Tower of Hanoi rules

private_information: You are allowed to move disks F G H I J only
You can place your disk only on top of a larger disk or an empty peg
agent_2.goal: Contribute to achieving the final configuration by moving allowed disks according to Tower of Hanoi rules

private_information: You coordinate the two agents and integrate their move sequences
You must produce a PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards planner
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' primitive move lists and produce a single PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that encodes the multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance and enforces agent move permissions

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi instance with 10 disks labeled A through J where A is the smallest and J is the largest
There are three pegs named left, middle, and right
Initial configuration: left peg from top to bottom contains A B C D E F G H I J, middle peg is empty, right peg is empty
Goal configuration: left peg from top to bottom E F G H I J, middle peg from top to bottom A, right peg from top to bottom B C D
Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk may be moved at a time, a disk moved must be the top disk of its peg, and a disk may only be placed on an empty peg or on top of a larger disk

plan.system_prompt: You are an expert in generating valid Tower of Hanoi primitive move sequences under agent-specific movement restrictions. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that obey the Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk permissions. Do not emit PDDL. Each move must be formatted exactly as: 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Use peg names left, middle, right.
plan.prompt: Your name is agent_1. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Your local objective is: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you can perform given your disk permissions. Only include moves that involve disks A B C D E. Ensure each move is valid at the time it is issued given the Tower of Hanoi rules. If you cannot complete the full global goal by yourself, produce only the moves you can perform that remain consistent with other legal moves.

plan.system_prompt: You are an expert in generating valid Tower of Hanoi primitive move sequences under agent-specific movement restrictions. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that obey the Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk permissions. Do not emit PDDL. Each move must be formatted exactly as: 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Use peg names left, middle, right.
plan.prompt: Your name is agent_2. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Your local objective is: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you can perform given your disk permissions. Only include moves that involve disks F G H I J. Ensure each move is valid at the time it is issued given the Tower of Hanoi rules. If you cannot complete the full global goal by yourself, produce only the moves you can perform that remain consistent with other legal moves.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and in preparing problems for the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the agents' primitive move sequences into a single consistent PDDL domain and PDDL problem that encodes the Tower of Hanoi rules, the initial state, the goal state, and agent-specific action permissions. You must produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions for agent_1 and agent_2 distinct and include agent identity in action names or predicates to enforce permissions.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You received two move lists from agent_1 and agent_2. Your job is to integrate their outputs and produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeted to the FastDownwards solver that represents the multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance and enforces which agent may move which disk. Use the following public information: {environment->public_information}. Use the following agent outputs: {moves_agent_1} and {moves_agent_2}. Think step by step and resolve any ordering conflicts or naming mismatches. Provide the PDDL domain and problem only. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
